What is the purpose of VerusHash 2.1, and how does it improve upon VerusHash 2.0?

VerusHash 2.1 is an adjustment to the equalization technology introduced in VerusHash 2.0. The goal of VerusHash 2.0 was to equalize the performance of FPGAs and modern CPUs, which it successfully achieved. VerusHash 2.1 aims to further improve this equalization, tilting the balance more favorably towards CPUs while still allowing FPGAs to operate on the hash algorithm with minor modifications.

## VerusHash 2.1
VerusHash 2.0 was the first algorithm to significantly equalize FPGAs dominance over CPUs, once they were introduced on the Verus network. While FPGAs were intentionally not blocked completely, which would simply drive the performance battle to the higher end and further into secret, the VerusHash 2.0 algorithm was developed to explicitly equalize FPGAs and modern CPUs and has met its original goals in keeping FPGA performance for the price under 2x of CPU. VerusHash 2.1 introduces an adjustment to the equalization technology, which we expect to tilt the balance a bit more favorably towards CPUs, while still enabling FPGAs to operate on the hash algorithm with minor modifications.
